page.title: 01The peat Bogs of Carstairs
page.content: This area mainly features wetland rocky hill areas - thus determining the long established quarrying for sand and gravel and recently the peat cutting industry. Farming is also apparent with the land being used mainly for grazing. The block contains three small villages Ravenstruther, Carstairs village and Carstairs Junction and although the area is rural and widespread the community appears to be close-knit due to the number of established groups and organisations. Work is limited main jobs being the quarries farms, chicken factory and the railway station at Crstairs Junction. Shops are few-but are sufficient for supplementary shopping.
